title: Takagi and Date and the Notebook Promise (Part 2)

sections.Situation:
Conan, Haibara and the Detective Boys have just visited Agasa due to his injury from a previous case and are now returning. They help each other to cheer Haibara up after the previous events, and luckily Yukiko also came back to cook for her at that time so everything was fine. However, they encounter a robber being chased by Inspector Takagi, he runs toward the boys, terrifying Haibara because she associated that image with Gin chasing her. Fortunately, Sato comes to the rescue in time, much to the admiration of the Detective Boys, and then when Takagi is about to write down the time the robber was captured in Date's notebook, he sees a string of characters and a note: Meet Takagi on Sunday. This made him remember the memory of his senior, the day before he passed away due to a traffic accident, Sato and the boys also begin to pay attention to the note above, and from here the decoding begins at Poirot's, where Conan quickly notices the code.
Azusa is a little surprised to see Takagi and Sato with the kids, but is later drawn into the group to solve the code, first starting with the reason why the code leads to Poirot's:
- Call the SMS center with a phone with a tone and a recorded message will play.
- Follow the instructions and enter the recipient's phone number
- Start the message with *2*2, compose the message with two numbers for each character according to this table, and finally end it with #s
Explaining why Date wanted to appeal to Takagi's male instincts, Amuro assumes that his deceased friend wanted Takagi to solve a case to become a real detective, and thinks that a shady plot might be going on here. While discussing the location, Conan notices a piece of tape under the table he and the others are sitting at, so he asks Azusa about it, who only remembers that there was a game console with a game running in sleep mode with tape right on the floor in that chair and she is now currently holding it. It seems that the person who was supposed to appear in the shop didn't show up, causing it to fall down after a while.
She is then asked if she had seen anyone suspicious, to which she mentions a boy who would make a strange gesture in front of the shop while in his car every Sunday afternoon. During those five minutes, the boy would always hold up five fingers, then fold his thumb, then fold his other four fingers, and then rewind the action. Conan and Haibara immediately recognize this as a distress signal after confirming that he was a foreigner, as the hand gesture was a distress signal originating from Canada.

sections.Manga to anime changes:
- Some dialogues not included in the anime:
- Sato suggests that she and Takagi have lunch at Poirot.
- Takagi mentions that Sato was working on different case when the kidnapping happened.
- The anime add the scene where Mitsuhiko suggests that they walk Haibara back to Agasa residence.
- In the manga, before capturing the robber, Sato crossed her arms in front. In the anime, she directly prepared to catch the robber.
- In the manga, after informing Conan about the gaming device, Azusa directly go to get it. In the anime, Conan has to ask Azusa what she did with the device before she go to get it.
- The anime did not include the scene where the Detective Boys ask Takagi the reason Date copying the code down in his notes instead of taking a picture with phone.
- The anime removes Detective Boys Badge usage by Sato when she asked Conan to get Alain from the car.
- The anime add some scene of Detective Boys where they wondering about "radio show about roads" and meaning of "soleil".
- In the manga, Conan directly deduced about Yuji's location is within thirty minute driving radius. In the anime, Takagi and Sato are the one who deduce it.
- In the manga, Conan directly deduced that the car was from underground parking garage and Alain was told to lie down when the car was moving. In the anime, Conan and Mitsuhiko have to ask Alain first about what he sees when he got into the car and when the car left the parking garage.
- The anime add the process of Alain trying to remember the flag color, while in the manga he directly said it.
- In the manga, when Takagi is asking the taxi driver to take him to the restaurant, he immediately saw the restaurant's flag. In the anime, there is a delay between him asking the taxi driver and him seeing the restaurant's flag.
- The anime add original dialogues for Takagi when he provokes the kidnapper, saying that he doubt the kidnapper had seen the news and can't do anyththing without his boss, then asking him to hand over Yuji if he don't want to be beaten to death.
